meanings.definition: Excessive adherence to liturgical forms and ceremonies.
meanings.sent1: Her liturgism was evident in the meticulous arrangement of candles and incense during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The church's liturgism was beautifully displayed in the traditional hymns and prayers.
meanings.sent3: John's liturgism reached new heights when he insisted on following every step of the ceremony exactly as written.
meanings.sent4: The liturgism of the event was so strict that even a slight deviation from the order caused a stir.
meanings.sent5: The liturgism of the rituals made the whole experience feel sacred and reverent.

meanings.definition: The practice or principles of liturgical worship.
meanings.sent1: The liturgism of the church emphasized the importance of structured and formal worship.
meanings.sent2: She found comfort in the liturgism of the service, following each ritual with devotion.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to adopt a form of liturgism, purring in a rhythmic pattern during the prayer.
meanings.sent4: As the choir sang in harmony, the liturgism of the music filled the entire cathedral.
meanings.sent5: The liturgism of the ceremony created a sense of unity and peace among the congregation.
